cards.name: Geist of Saint Traft
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Geist of Saint Traft attacks, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying that's tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.
cards.original_text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Geist of Saint Traft attacks, put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.

rulings.text: You declare which player or planeswalker the token is attacking as you put it onto the battlefield. It doesn't have to be the same player or planeswalker Geist of Saint Traft is attacking.
Although the token is attacking, it was never declared as an attacking creature (for purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

cards.name: Bonds of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.
cards.flavor:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound."
—Oath of Avacyn
cards.original_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.

rulings.text: Once the enchanted creature has been declared as an attacking or blocking creature, causing it to stop being a Human won't remove it from combat. It will lose the +2/+2 bonus, however.

cards.name: Cathedral Sanctifier
cards.text: When Cathedral Sanctifier enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: "Evil will soon be vanquished. What Innistrad most needs now is healing."
cards.original_text: When Cathedral Sanctifier enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Champion of the Parish
cards.text: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.
cards.flavor: "I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."
cards.original_text: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.

cards.name: Chapel Geist
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Death has bound it with chains of past regrets. Forever it searches for atonement, each kindness removing a single link.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Dearly Departed
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Dearly Departed is in your graveyard, each Human creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"Never forget our ancestors. They have not forgotten us."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch
cards.original_text:
Flying
As long as Dearly Departed is in your graveyard, each Human creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: The effect is cumulative. Human creatures you control will enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter for each Dearly Departed in your graveyard.

In most cases, when determining whether a creature entering the battlefield under your control should get a +1/+1 counter, you'll simply look at what the creature will looklike on the battlefield. You'll consider any effects affecting a creature entering the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
cards.original_text: When Doomed Traveler dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Eerie Interlude
cards.text: Exile any number of target creatures you control. Return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The barrier between existence and oblivion is thinner than you know.
cards.original_text: Exile any number of target creatures you control. Return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: Auras attached to the exiled creatures will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled creatures will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled creatures will cease to exist.
If a creature token is exiled, it ceases to exist. It won't be returned to the battlefield.
If a double-faced card is exiled, it will return with its front face up.

cards.name: Elder Cathar
cards.text: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.
cards.flavor: "My greatest hope is that you will surpass me in every way, consigning my name to some forgotten corner of history."
cards.original_text: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.

cards.name: Emancipation Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Emancipation Angel enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "You have done your best. I give you leave to rest."
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Emancipation Angel enters the battlefield, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: The triggered ability doesn't target a permanent. You choose which one to return to its owner's hand as the ability resolves. No one can respond to the choice.
If Emancipation Angel is still on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, you may return Emancipation Angel itself.

cards.name: Fiend Hunter
cards.text:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.original_text:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted creature indefinitely.

Once the exiled permanent returns, it's considered a new object with no relation to the object that it was. Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.
If a token is exiled this way, it won't return to the battlefield.

cards.name: Gather the Townsfolk
cards.text:
Create two 1/1 white Human creature tokens.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, create five of those tokens instead.
cards.flavor: In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city.
cards.original_text:
Put two 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, put five of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.

cards.name: Goldnight Redeemer
cards.text:
Flying
When Goldnight Redeemer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each other creature you control.
cards.flavor: The Host sings of Avacyn's return without a single verse about its own suffering.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Goldnight Redeemer enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each other creature you control.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is based on the number of other creatures you control when the ability resolves.

cards.name: Increasing Devotion
cards.text:
Create five 1/1 white Human creature tokens. If Increasing Devotion was cast from a graveyard, create ten of those tokens instead.
Flashback {7}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Put five 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield. If Increasing Devotion was cast from a graveyard, put ten of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.
Flashback {7}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Momentary Blink
cards.text:
Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
Flashback {3}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
Flashback {3}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: When Momentary Blink resolves, the creature is exiled, then immediately returned to the battlefield. The game sees the returning card as a different permanent from the one that left the battlefield. Any counters, Auras, and so on are removed. Any spells or abilities targeting the creature no longer target it.
Any "as this enters the battlefield" choices for the affected creature are made by its owner, not its old controller.
If Momentary Blink is cast on a token creature, the token will not return to the battlefield, because of the rule that says a token that leaves the battlefield can't come back.

cards.name: Moorland Inquisitor
cards.text: {2}{W}: Moorland Inquisitor gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Inquisitors are taught scripture, philosophy, and the fine art of sharpening an axe.
cards.original_text: {2}{W}: Moorland Inquisitor gains first strike until end of turn.

foreign_names.name: ムーアランドの審問官

cards.name: Rebuke
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.original_text: Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.name: Slayer of the Wicked
cards.text: When Slayer of the Wicked enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Vampire, Werewolf, or Zombie.
cards.flavor: You don't want to see his trophy room.
cards.original_text: When Slayer of the Wicked enters the battlefield, you may destroy target Vampire, Werewolf, or Zombie.

rulings.text: If you control the only Vampire, Werewolf, or Zombie, you must target it with Slayer of the Wicked's ability. You choose whether or not to destroy the target when the ability resolves.

foreign_names.name: 忌まわしきものの処刑者

cards.name: Spectral Gateguards
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Spectral Gateguards is paired with another creature, both creatures have vigilance.
cards.original_text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Spectral Gateguards is paired with another creature, both creatures have vigilance.

cards.name: Thraben Heretic
cards.text: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."
cards.original_text: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.

cards.name: Topplegeist
cards.text:
Flying
When Topplegeist enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, tap target creature that player controls.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Topplegeist enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, tap target creature that player controls.

rulings.text: The card types in Magic are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal (a card type that appears on some older cards). Supertypes (such as legendary and basic) and subtypes (such as Human and Equipment) are not counted.
The number of card types matters, not the number of cards. For example, Wicker Witch (an artifact creature) along with Catalog (an instant) and Chaplain's Blessing (a sorcery) will enable delirium.
Because you consider only the characteristics of a double-faced card's front face while it's not on the battlefield, the types of its back face won't be counted for delirium.

In some rare cases, you can have a token or a copy of a spell in your graveyard at the moment that an object's delirium ability counts the card types among cards in your graveyard, before that token or copy ceases to exist. Because tokens and copies of spells are not cards, even if they are copies of cards, their types will never be counted.

Most triggered delirium abilities use an intervening "if" clause. There must be four or more card types among cards in your graveyard in order for these abilities to trigger, otherwise they never trigger at all. There's no way to have the ability trigger if there aren't enough card types, even if you intend to raise that number in response to the triggered ability. The number of card types is checked again as the trigger resolves, and if it has become too low somehow, the ability does nothing. If which card types are in your graveyard changes but the quantity of card types stays the same (or increases), then the delirium triggered ability will still resolve.

cards.name: Village Bell-Ringer
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Village Bell-Ringer enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.
cards.flavor: "Priests, hunters, slayers—to arms! The enemy approaches!"
cards.original_text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Village Bell-Ringer enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.

rulings.text: Untapping an attacking creature doesn't remove it from combat.

cards.name: Voice of the Provinces
cards.text:
Flying
When Voice of the Provinces enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Human creature token.
cards.flavor: Her horn is heard across Innistrad, lifting the hearts of the righteous.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Voice of the Provinces enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Captain of the Mists
cards.text:
Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, untap Captain of the Mists.
{1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target permanent.
cards.flavor: "I am no mere ship's captain. The north wind is my accomplice. The tide is my first mate."
cards.original_text:
Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, untap Captain of the Mists.
{1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target permanent.

cards.name: Gryff Vanguard
cards.text:
Flying
When Gryff Vanguard enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Ghouls smashed the door, but I heard the call of the gryffs and knew we were saved."
—Ekka, shopkeeper of Hanweir
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Gryff Vanguard enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Mist Raven
cards.text:
Flying
When Mist Raven enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"When you see a raven, head for the hills. It knows when the ghost-tide is headed in."
—Sved, fisherman of Nephalia
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Mist Raven enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: Mist Raven's ability is mandatory. If Mist Raven is the only creature on the battlefield when its ability triggers, you must choose it as the target.

cards.name: Nephalia Smuggler
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}: Exile another target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: "My drivers are trustworthy. I removed their tongues myself. Any other questions?"
cards.original_text: {3}{U}, {T}: Exile another target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Pore Over the Pages
cards.text: Draw three cards, untap up to two lands, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: "'I'm certain that the fate of Markov Manor is connected to these cryptoliths . . .' This Tamiyo was on to something."
cards.original_text: Draw three cards, untap up to two lands, then discard a card.

rulings.text: You choose which lands to untap after you have drawn three cards. Lands controlled by any player may be untapped this way.

cards.name: Tandem Lookout
cards.text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Tandem Lookout is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, draw a card."
cards.original_text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Tandem Lookout is paired with another creature, each of those creatures has "Whenever this creature deals damage to an opponent, draw a card."

rulings.text: If Tandem Lookout or the creature it's paired with is dealt lethal damage at the same time that either deals damage to an opponent, its ability triggers. You'll draw a card even though that creature no longer has the ability.

cards.name: Tower Geist
cards.text:
Flying
When Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

rulings.text: If there's only one card in your library when Tower Geist enters the battlefield, you'll look at that card and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Butcher's Cleaver
cards.flavor: Outside the safety of Thraben, there is little distinction between tool and weapon.

cards.name: Sharpened Pitchfork
cards.flavor: Not everyone can have a sword of blessed silver. Not everyone needs one, either.

cards.name: Seraph Sanctuary
cards.text:
When Seraph Sanctuary enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
Whenever an Angel enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {C}.
cards.original_text:
When Seraph Sanctuary enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
Whenever an Angel enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tranquil Cove
cards.text:
Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield tapped.
When Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.
cards.original_text:
Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield tapped.
When Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mindwrack Demon
cards.text:
Flying, trample
When Mindwrack Demon enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
Delirium — At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 4 life unless there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
cards.original_text:
Flying, trample
When Mindwrack Demon enters the battlefield, put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.
Delirium — At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 4 life unless there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

rulings.text: Mindwrack Demon's delirium triggered ability does not include an intervening "if" clause. This ability triggers at the beginning of your upkeep regardless of the number of types in your graveyard, and it checks that number as it resolves to determine whether you lose 4 life or not.

The card types in Magic are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal (a card type that appears on some older cards). Supertypes (such as legendary and basic) and subtypes (such as Human and Equipment) are not counted.
The number of card types matters, not the number of cards. For example, Wicker Witch (an artifact creature) along with Catalog (an instant) and Chaplain's Blessing (a sorcery) will enable delirium.
Because you consider only the characteristics of a double-faced card's front face while it's not on the battlefield, the types of its back face won't be counted for delirium.

In some rare cases, you can have a token or a copy of a spell in your graveyard at the moment that an object's delirium ability counts the card types among cards in your graveyard, before that token or copy ceases to exist. Because tokens and copies of spells are not cards, even if they are copies of cards, their types will never be counted.

cards.name: Compelling Deterrence
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card if you control a Zombie.
cards.flavor: "So much for neighborly hospitality!"
cards.original_text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card if you control a Zombie.

rulings.text: The card returned to its owner's hand may be the card they discard. If it's the only card in that player's hand, it must be discarded.
Compelling Deterrence targets only the nonland permanent. If that permanent becomes an illegal target, Compelling Deterrence doesn't resolve and that player doesn't discard a card.
If you target the only Zombie you control with Compelling Deterrence, you won't discard a card.

cards.name: Forbidden Alchemy
cards.text:
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: If you have fewer than four cards in your library, you'll look at all the cards there and put one into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Havengul Runebinder
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.
cards.flavor: "So many corpses, so little time."
cards.original_text: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.

rulings.text: Although players may respond to the activated ability, they can't respond to the paying of its costs. The creature card will already be exiled by the time any player could respond.
The Zombie creature token you put onto the battlefield will also get a +1/+1 counter.

foreign_names.name: ヘイヴングルのルーン縛り

cards.name: Makeshift Mauler
cards.text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"It always amazes me what perfectly good things people throw away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
cards.original_text: As an additional cost to cast Makeshift Mauler, exile a creature card from your graveyard.

rulings.text: You must exile exactly one creature card from your graveyard to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without exiling a creature card, and you cannot exile additional creature cards.

Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to otherwise remove the creature card you exiled in order to prevent you from casting this spell.

foreign_names.name: その場しのぎのやっかいもの

cards.name: Relentless Skaabs
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.original_text:
As an additional cost to cast Relentless Skaabs, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

rulings.text: When Relentless Skaabs returns to the battlefield because of its undying ability, it's not being cast. You won't exile a creature card from your graveyard.
You must exile exactly one creature card from your graveyard to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without exiling a creature card, and you cannot exile additional creature cards.

Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to otherwise remove the creature card you exiled in order to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Scrapskin Drake
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Scrapskin Drake can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
cards.original_text:
Flying
Scrapskin Drake can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Screeching Skaab
cards.text: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.
cards.original_text: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.name: Stitched Drake
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Flying
cards.flavor:
"The best skaabs are more powerful and more beautiful than the sum of their parts."
—Stitcher Geralf
cards.original_text:
As an additional cost to cast Stitched Drake, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Flying

rulings.text: You must exile exactly one creature card from your graveyard to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without exiling a creature card, and you cannot exile additional creature cards.

Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to otherwise remove the creature card you exiled in order to prevent you from casting this spell.

foreign_names.name: 縫い合わせのドレイク

cards.name: Abattoir Ghoul
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Abattoir Ghoul this turn dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Death took his humanity but not his skill with the knife.
cards.original_text:
First strike
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Abattoir Ghoul this turn dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

rulings.text: You'll gain life equal to the creature's last known toughness before it died. For example, if Abattoir Ghoul deals 3 first-strike damage to a 7/7 creature and then you give the creature -5/-5 before the regular combat damage step, you'll gain 2 life.

cards.name: Appetite for Brains
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it with converted mana cost 4 or greater and exile that card.
cards.flavor: Just as with a peach, the first bite is always the juiciest.
cards.original_text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it with converted mana cost 4 or greater and exile that card.

rulings.text: If a card in a player's hand has {X} in its mana cost, X is 0.

cards.name: Barter in Blood
cards.text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
cards.flavor:
"We must all make sacrifices for the good of Innistrad."
—Sorin Markov
cards.original_text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.

rulings.text: The active player chooses which creatures will be sacrificed first, then each other player in turn order does the same. Then all creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.
If a player controls only one creature, that creature is sacrificed.
Barter in Blood doesn't target any creatures and may be cast even if a player controls fewer than two creatures.

cards.name: Butcher Ghoul
cards.text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: Without a mind, it doesn't fear death. Without a soul, it doesn't mind killing.
cards.original_text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Diregraf Ghoul
cards.text: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.original_text: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Dread Return
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback—Sacrifice three creatures. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: The will to return can overpower the will to survive.
cards.original_text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback—Sacrifice three creatures. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Driver of the Dead
cards.text: When Driver of the Dead dies, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Some vampires resorted to corpse trading after cathars burned their estates and drove them from their ancestral feeding grounds.
cards.original_text: When Driver of the Dead dies, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If Driver of the Dead dies at the same time as a creature with converted mana cost 2 or less, you can target that card and return it to the battlefield.

cards.name: Falkenrath Noble
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Falkenrath Noble or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.text: When Ghoulraiser enters the battlefield, return a Zombie card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.original_text: When Ghoulraiser enters the battlefield, return a Zombie card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Gravecrawler
cards.text:
Gravecrawler can't block.
You may cast Gravecrawler from your graveyard as long as you control a Zombie.
cards.flavor:
"Innistrad's ghoulcallers are talented enough, but let me show you what someone with real power can create."
—Liliana Vess
cards.original_text:
Gravecrawler can't block.
You may cast Gravecrawler from your graveyard as long as you control a Zombie.

rulings.text: Gravecrawler's ability doesn't change when you could cast it.
Once you've cast Gravecrawler and it's on the stack, it doesn't matter if you lose control of the other Zombie.

cards.name: Sever the Bloodline
cards.text:
Exile target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.original_text:
Exile target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: Only creatures on the battlefield will be exiled. In other zones, they're "creature cards," not "creatures."
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Sever the Bloodline resolves, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No creatures will be exiled.

Unless a token is a copy of another creature or was explicitly given a name by the effect that created it, its name is the creature types it was given when it was created. For example, the Beast tokens created by Thragtusk and by Baloth Cage Trap are both named "Beast."
A double-faced creature only has the name of the face that's up. For example, if Village Ironsmith is targeted by Sever the Bloodline, Ironfang wouldn't be exiled.

cards.name: Tooth Collector
cards.text:
When Tooth Collector enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, target creature that player controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.original_text:
When Tooth Collector enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, target creature that player controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The card types in Magic are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal (a card type that appears on some older cards). Supertypes (such as legendary and basic) and subtypes (such as Human and Equipment) are not counted.
The number of card types matters, not the number of cards. For example, Wicker Witch (an artifact creature) along with Catalog (an instant) and Chaplain's Blessing (a sorcery) will enable delirium.
Because you consider only the characteristics of a double-faced card's front face while it's not on the battlefield, the types of its back face won't be counted for delirium.

In some rare cases, you can have a token or a copy of a spell in your graveyard at the moment that an object's delirium ability counts the card types among cards in your graveyard, before that token or copy ceases to exist. Because tokens and copies of spells are not cards, even if they are copies of cards, their types will never be counted.

Most triggered delirium abilities use an intervening "if" clause. There must be four or more card types among cards in your graveyard in order for these abilities to trigger, otherwise they never trigger at all. There's no way to have the ability trigger if there aren't enough card types, even if you intend to raise that number in response to the triggered ability. The number of card types is checked again as the trigger resolves, and if it has become too low somehow, the ability does nothing. If which card types are in your graveyard changes but the quantity of card types stays the same (or increases), then the delirium triggered ability will still resolve.

cards.name: Tribute to Hunger
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .
cards.original_text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the creature's toughness as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.name: Unbreathing Horde
cards.text:
Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other Zombie you control and each Zombie card in your graveyard.
If Unbreathing Horde would be dealt damage, prevent that damage and remove a +1/+1 counter from it.
cards.original_text:
Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other Zombie you control and each Zombie card in your graveyard.
If Unbreathing Horde would be dealt damage, prevent that damage and remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

rulings.text: Only one +1/+1 counter will be removed, no matter how much damage is prevented.
If Unbreathing Horde has no +1/+1 counters on it (but its toughness is raised above 0 by another effect), any damage dealt to it will still be prevented, even though no counter will be removed.
If Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield from a graveyard, it will count itself when determining how many +1/+1 counters it enters the battlefield with.
